etymology.description: 山(山) (shān, "mountain") as semantic + 領(領) (lǐng, "neck, collar") as phonetic = mountain ridge -> ridge; mountain range
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 山(山) (shān, "mountain") to convey the concept of a mountainous terrain with the phonetic 領(領) (lǐng, "neck, collar") to suggest sound, emphasizing the ridge-like quality of a mountain range.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by replacing the phonetic 領(領) (lǐng, "neck, collar") with a similar-looking and phonetically matching component 岭(岭).

examples.chinese: 山岭蜿蜒(山嶺蜿蜒)，远处连绵不绝(遠處連綿不絕)。
examples.pinyin: shān lǐng wān yán, yuǎn chù lián mián bù jué.
examples.english: The ridge winds through the mountains, with endless ranges in the distance.

examples.chinese: 这条岭贯穿全山脉(這條嶺貫穿全山脈)。
examples.pinyin: zhè tiáo lǐng guàn chuān quán shān mài.
examples.english: This ridge runs through the entire mountain range.
